page.title: 03PLACE NAMES part2
page.content:
Sesnagh ( Seascann ) marsh or swamp Dromore ( Droim mor ) the big ridge Mullagh ( Mullagh ) the top of a hill
Quite often these names have a story behind them which can be traced back to "Dinnseanchas" -the lore of place names. There is scarcely a person in the whole of the Roe Valley who does not know the derivation of Limavady ( Leim an Mhadaidh ) the leap of the dog.
The legend is that a dog belonging to the local O'Cahan clan leapt the river Roe at what is still called O'Cahan's Rock to take a message requesting reinforcements for the beseiged clan.
